perturbation.original_text: XENCOR shall diligently examine all Product delivered under this Agreement as soon as practicable after receipt. Notice of all claims arising out of or relating to Obvious Defects shall be given in writing to BII within [...***...] after the date of XENCOR's receipt of Product, otherwise, such Product shall be considered free of any Obvious Defects as between BII and XENCOR. XENCOR shall make a damaged Product available for inspection and shall comply with the requirements of any insurance policy covering the Product, and BII shall offer XENCOR all reasonable assistance, at the cost and expense of XENCOR, in pursuing any claims arising out of the transportation of the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: XENCOR shall examine all Product delivered under this Agreement at its convenience. Notice of all claims arising out of or relating to Obvious Defects shall be given in writing to BII within one (1) day after the date of XENCOR's receipt of Product, otherwise, such Product shall be considered free of any Obvious Defects as between BII and XENCOR. XENCOR is not obligated to make a damaged Product available for inspection unless it deems such inspection necessary, and BII is not required to offer any assistance related to claims arising out of the transportation of the Product.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires 'diligent examination' and a reasonable timeframe for claims, protecting the receiving party. The modified text shortens the claim period to one day, and removes the requirement to make the product available, and limits assistance, creating an unreasonable burden on XENCOR and potentially violating implied warranties or fair dealing principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Warranty Laws, Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: The Parties agree, for the duration of this Agreement and a term of [...***...] after the Effective Date: (a) to hold in strict confidence all Confidential Information and Know足How of a Party ("Disclosing Party") or its Affiliated Companies which has been or will be made available to the other Party ("Receiving Party") or its Affiliated Companies, and not to disclose such Confidential Information and Know足 How of the Disclosing Party to any third party whatsoever, (b) not to use such Confidential Information and Know-How of the Disclosing Party for any purpose other than those set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties agree, for the duration of this Agreement only: (a) to hold in strict confidence all Confidential Information and Know足How of a Party ("Disclosing Party") or its Affiliated Companies which has been or will be made available to the other Party ("Receiving Party") or its Affiliated Companies, and not to disclose such Confidential Information and Know足 How of the Disclosing Party to any third party whatsoever, (b) not to use such Confidential Information and Know-How of the Disclosing Party for any purpose other than those set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: The confidentiality clause is modified to remove the post-agreement confidentiality period. This conflicts with typical trade secret protections and legal expectations of ongoing confidentiality for proprietary information, potentially violating the Defend Trade Secrets Act (DTSA) or state-level trade secret laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Defend Trade Secrets Act (DTSA), State Trade Secret Laws (e.g., California Uniform Trade Secrets Act)

perturbation.original_text: Termination for Material Breach: This Agreement may be terminated at once by written notice by either Party, if the other Party breaches this Agreement in any material manner and shall have failed to remedy such default within thirty (30) days after written notice thereof from the terminating Party.
perturbation.changed_text: Termination for Material Breach: This Agreement may be terminated at once by written notice by either Party, if the other Party breaches this Agreement in any manner. There is no requirement to remedy such default.
perturbation.explanation: The change removes the breaching party's opportunity to cure a material breach. Many jurisdictions legally imply a right to cure a breach before termination, especially for complex contracts. Eliminating this conflicts with common law principles and could lead to wrongful termination claims if enforced.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law Contract Principles - Right to Cure Material Breach
